description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House editor Jordan Fabian looks at the president’s drive to strike trade deals. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Puts Himself at Center Stage in Tariff Negotiations

description: Immigration advocates are racing to file new lawsuits challenging President Donald Trump’s deportations under a rarely used wartime law after the US Supreme Court tossed out a lower court judge’s nationwide pause.
title: Trump Faces Surge of Deportation Lawsuits Over War Power Act

description: A US appeals court denied an emergency motion by the Trump administration to halt a federal judge’s effort to facilitate the return of a Maryland man wrongly deported to a prison in his native El Salvador, saying the Justice Department’s conduct was shocking to Americans’ “sense of liberty.”
title: Trump Loses Emergency Appeal to Halt Maryland Deportation Case

description: President Donald Trump has discussed firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell with some of his top advisers, according to the Wall Street Journal.
title: Trump Has Discussed Firing Powell With Advisers, WSJ Reports

description: The Trump administration’s threat to end foreign enrollment at Harvard University places in danger a key funding source for US schools — and could prompt international students to seek degrees elsewhere.
title: Harvard Finances at Risk From Threatened Foreign Student Ban

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy accused China of supplying weapons to Russia in its war against his country, saying he will present detailed evidence next week.
title: Zelenskiy Accuses China of Supplying Weapons to Russia

description: A House panel is launching a civil rights investigation into Harvard University, joining President Donald Trump in his campaign against the school.
title: House Panel Launches Probe Into Harvard, Joining Trump’s Attack

description: The US Supreme Court said it will hear arguments on President Donald Trump’s bid to start enforcing an executive order that would restrict automatic birthright citizenship and upend a longstanding constitutional right.
title: Supreme Court Will Hear Arguments in Birthright Citizenship Case

description: President Donald Trump said the US and Ukraine would sign a deal on critical minerals next Thursday, in a step expected to keep Kyiv in good favor as the White House seeks to broker a quick ceasefire deal with Russia.
title: Trump Says US to Sign Ukraine Minerals Deal Next Thursday

description: One stroller company is warning customers that price hikes due to new US tariffs are unavoidable, while an environmentally friendly cleaning-product brand is providing an itemized list of goods that are getting more expensive. A luggage retailer, meanwhile, has described the situation as “a complete dumpster fire.”
title: Retailers Are Directly Blaming Tariffs for New Price Increases

description: Ivory Coast’s main opposition party overwhelmingly endorsed former Credit Suisse Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam as its candidate for president in this year’s election.
title: Ex-Credit Suisse CEO to Run for President in Ivory Coast

description: Weather analysis tools used by a wide array of businesses and government entities across the US have gone dark after funding for long-running regional climate hubs lapsed.
title: US Weather Analysis for 21 States Goes Dark After Funding Lapse

description: The European Union is working on a proposal to introduce restrictions on some exports to the US as a possible retaliatory tactic in the expansive trade war President Donald Trump initiated last month.
title: EU Weighs Export Restrictions on US If Trade Negotiations Fail

description: Saudi Arabia’s Defense Minister Khalid Bin Salman met Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Thursday, a sign that Riyadh is taking an active role in efforts to avoid a major security crisis between the US and Tehran.
title: Saudi Minister’s Tehran Trip Signals Push to Forge US-Iran Detente

description: The Texas House of Representatives passed a $1 billion school voucher program, a key victory in Governor Greg Abbott’s long quest to establish school choice.
title: Trump-Backed School Choice Bill Clears Key Hurdle in Texas

description: CEOs, doctors, lawyers and Wall Street bankers are the likeliest to feel the impact if President Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress boost taxes on millionaires. Billionaires, on the other hand, are likely to skate.
title: Trump’s Millionaire Tax Would Hit CEOs, Wall Street Bankers While Billionaires Slide

description: Fewer Americans are viewing China as an enemy, according to a survey by Pew Research Center, a sentiment that runs counter to the tariff war instigated by Donald Trump.
title: Fewer Americans Consider China an Enemy During Trump’s Trade War

description: French President Emmanuel Macron met with US envoy Steve Witkoff Thursday, with the discussion focused primarily on peace talks to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the Elysee said.
title: Macron, Witkoff Discuss Ukraine Peace Talks in Paris Meeting

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met Iran’s top diplomat ahead of a second round of talks between the US and the Islamic Republic aimed at resolving the standoff over Tehran’s nuclear program.
title: Putin Met Iran’s Foreign Minister Ahead of Tehran’s Next Talks With US

description: The Trump administration is offering the Washington, DC headquarters of the Department of Housing and Urban Development for sale as it seeks to reduce its real estate footprint for a shrinking federal workforce.
title: HUD Building Put Up for Sale as Trump Looks to Unload Properties

description: French billionaire Bernard Arnault, whose group LVMH owns Champagne labels like Moët & Chandon and Veuve Clicquot as well as Hennessy Cognac, called on the European Union to strike a deal with the US on tariffs to defend the region’s winegrowers.
title: Billionaire Arnault Urges EU-US Tariff Deal to Help Winegrowers

description: British farmers are planning to mount a legal challenge against the government for its unexpected decision to shutter a grant program for farms, in the latest sign of growing tensions between the ruling Labour Party and rural communities.
title: UK Farmers Plan Legal Challenge Over Canceled Subsidies

description: The US may provide financing to companies operating in the Democratic Republic of Congo through the Export–Import Bank of the United States and the US International Development Finance Corp. as part of a potential critical minerals partnership, a senior US official said.
title: US Makes Progress on Minerals Deal With Congo, Adviser Says

description: It will be difficult for Poland to curb its fiscal deficit in the coming years as the European Union’s looser fiscal rules may prompt more spending during an election cycle, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.
title: EBRD Sees Risks to Poland’s Pledge to Curb Deficit

description: President Donald Trump will discuss ways to boost American energy exports and foster cooperation in artificial intelligence when he meets Thursday with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, according to senior US officials, as she visits the White House in search of tariff relief.
title: Trump, Meloni to Discuss Energy Exports, AI in Tariff Talks

description: The head of Europe’s insurance watchdog said the US Treasury market’s recent volatility is bringing into question its status as a safe haven.
title: Europe’s Financial Watchdogs Question Treasuries’ Haven Status

description: The chairman of a US congressional committee on China is calling on Bank of America Corp. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. to withdraw from working on the Hong Kong first-time share sale of battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., which could be the year’s biggest listing.
title: House China Committee Urges US Banks to Drop CATL Listing Roles

description: Somalia’s semi-autonomous region of Somaliland suspended its participation in Turkey-backed talks aimed at reconciling differences between their governments, a setback to efforts to stabilize the volatile region.
title: Breakaway Somali Region Quits Turkey-Backed Reconciliation Talks

description: Russia’s Supreme Court lifted a ban on the Taliban, the latest step in growing relations between Moscow and the Islamist group in Afghanistan.
title: Russia Lifts Ban on Taliban Amid Deepening Ties With the Group

description: Austria’s new finance minister, Markus Marterbauer, signaled support for using frozen Russian central bank assets to provide further help for Ukraine to defend itself.
title: Austria Backs Using Frozen Russian Assets to Help Ukraine

description: The head of the UN’s nuclear watchdog said talks between Iran and the US are at a “crucial stage” and warned the two countries have limited time to resolve their years-long standoff over Tehran’s atomic activities.
title: IAEA’s Grossi Says US-Iran Nuclear Talks Are at ‘Crucial Stage’

description: India and China have agreed to resume an annual pilgrimage to the Tibet Autonomous Region, in another sign of improving ties between the two nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: India and China to Resume Annual Pilgrimage Soon as Ties Improve

description: Italy will likely be able to increase its defense spending to reach a NATO target of 2% of gross domestic product as early as this year, Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said.
title: Italy Says It Can Meet NATO 2% Defense Spending Target in 2025

description: Austria’s three-way coalition faces a tougher task repairing public finances than previously thought as additional spending is set to keep the budget deficit stubbornly high this year, according to the country’s new finance minister.
title: Austria’s New Finance Chief Sees Wider Deficit Than Expected

description: President Donald Trump said Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s termination from that position can’t come quickly enough, arguing that the Fed should have lowered rates already and in any case should do so now.
title: Trump Says Fed Chair Powell’s Termination Can’t Come Fast Enough

description: Poland will soon bolster its military deployment to Latvia to beef up the defense of frontline states in NATO’s east, said the country’s defense chief.
title: Poland Sends More Troops to Latvia to Beef Up NATO’s East Flank

description: Data shows that even in wealthy congressional districts, the average person isn’t much affected by the state and local tax deduction lawmakers are trying to boost.
title: Congress Is Prioritizing a Tax Break That Few Americans Will Claim

description: A majority of White Zimbabweans who lost their farms during a land grab more than 20 years ago have rejected an offer of dollar bonds as part of a government pay off.
title: Zimbabwe Ex-Farmer’s Reject Pay-Off in Dollar Bonds for Land Seizures

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Japan Seeks to Evade Trump-China Trade Squeeze

description: Some young Chinese people are taking slacking off to a whole new level, celebrating a life of very little ambition — and even less work — as “rat people.”
title: Young Chinese Take Slacking Off to New Heights as ‘Rat People’

description: Thailand’s rate-setters will weigh the impact of US tariffs on the country’s growth, inflation and trade as it reviews monetary policy at a scheduled meeting on April 30, according to central bank Assistant Governor Sakkapop Panyanukul.
title: BOT To Weigh Tariff Impact on Growth, Rate Path at Next Meeting

description: Giancarlo Zorrilla attended a campaign rally for the first time in his life in March. It was a rainy night near Vancouver — typical weather for Canada’s west coast — but that wasn’t stopping the 29-year-old Canadian from seeing Pierre Poilievre speak.
title: Canada’s Gen Z Voters Turn to Conservative Poilievre in Race Against Carney

description: It’s starting to look like déjà vu all over again for Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk as his preferred candidate for president sinks in opinion polls a month before the election.
title: Polish Presidential Campaign Heats Up as Front-Runner Stumbles

description: The Trump administration is asking a US appeals court to block a judge’s directive that government officials be questioned about their failure to seek the return of a Maryland man wrongly deported to El Salvador.
title: US Seeks to Halt Hunt for Evidence on Maryland Man’s Deportation

description: Harvard University pushed back after President Donald Trump said the school should lose its tax-exempt status and several outlets reported that the IRS is considering the issue, escalating a feud between the federal government and America’s richest university.
title: Harvard Says IRS Revoking Tax-Exempt Status Would Be ‘Unlawful’

description: Tempted by talk of rapprochement between Washington and Moscow, companies remain wary of a radically changed Russian market.
title: Western Firms Balk at Price of Admission for Return to Russia

description: The possibility of sanctions being eased and an end to the war in Ukraine has some Western businesses and investors eying opportunities in Russia
title: If Trump Lifts Sanctions on Russia, What Would It Mean?

description: Just as Elon Musk launched his push to boost US government efficiency, Poland’s prime minister turned to a local billionaire who revolutionized European logistics to lead his country’s deregulation drive.
title: Is This Poland’s Elon Musk? Billionaire Declares War on Red Tape

description: Lesotho is at risk of a liquidity crisis if US President Donald Trump follows through on plans to impose a 50% levy on imports from the tiny southern African mountain kingdom, its trade minister warned.
title: Trump’s Harsh Tariff Sparks Fear of Liquidity Crisis in Lesotho

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping promoted the idea of an “Asian family” and called for regional unity during a tour of Southeast Asia, in an apparent effort to counter US pressure on nations to limit trade ties with Beijing.
title: Xi Urges ‘Asian Family’ Unity as Trump Pressures Trade Partners

description: The Trump administration has sent home staffers at AmeriCorps, the national agency that supports public service and volunteerism, in the latest agency takeover as part of a wide-ranging effort to cut the size of government.
title: Trump Shuts Down Volunteer Agency in Latest DOGE Takeover

description: BANGKOK (AP) — The head of Myanmar’s military government granted amnesty to around 4,900 prisoners to mark the country's traditional new year, state-run media reported Thursday, but it wasn’t immediately clear how many were political detainees locked up for opposing army rule.
title: Myanmar Frees Nearly 5,000 Prisoners to Mark Traditional New Year

description: The US and Japan kicked off tariff negotiations with an aim to reach a deal as soon as possible but did not discuss currency issues, Japan’s top negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said.
title: US, Japan Begin Formal Tariff Talks Without Discussing Forex
